newsitem.title: UK: Two Brent cargoes trade - October barrels cleared.
newsitem.headline: Two Brent cargoes trade - October barrels cleared.

text.p: Following two physical Brent deals on Tuesday October barrels of the grade were sold out, traders said.
"It looks like it (October Brent) is all gone. If this ULCC does go to the U.S. the market looks firmer," one commented.
The trader expected to take the ULCC to the U.S. now owns five end October maximum size Brent cargoes.
"There may have to be some swapping around to get the right cargoes to fit on the vessel, but basically it is sorted out and November is looking stronger already," another commented.
November Brent on the IPE lost some of Monday's gains to trade at 1630 GMT down 14 cents at $24.72 a barrel.

As November North Sea barrels started to move levels were seen steady to firmer - a Gullfaks Nov 1-3 moved at dated Brent +39 cents and unconfirmed talk of a first decade November Statfjord traded at dated Brent +40-43 cents was thought low by some prospective buyers.
Other wet trade included a Troll Nov 9-11 at dated +60 cents, a Nov 6-10 Draugen at dated +50 cents.
Urals in the North was heard well balanced with loadings still delayed by 1-2 days.
Brent Dec/Jan traded three times between +67-70 cents while further forward a Dec/Mar was heard at $2.18.
On the CFD market the October 21-25 was the most actively traded week and gained ground later to discussion around Dec +22/26 cents after earlier trading at Dec +21 cents.
